title: Providing an Order of Succession Within the Office of the National Cyber Director

enrichment.summary: This executive order establishes a clear succession order for who will lead the Office of the National Cyber Director if the current Director becomes unable to perform their duties. It defines a specific list of officials authorized to act as Director and clarifies exceptions and presidential discretion in assigning an acting Director.
potential_concerns: Ambiguity about the practical application of presidential discretion could lead to disputes or confusion during transitions.
Excluding individuals serving in acting capacities from succession might limit flexibility in emergency scenarios.
Potential for delays or operational disruptions if successors are ineligible under the Federal Vacancies Reform Act.
Lack of protections or guidelines to ensure continuity of leadership during extended vacancies could impact cybersecurity governance.
The order does not specify procedures for informing relevant stakeholders or the public about succession changes, possibly reducing transparency.
